name: From Autumn to Zirconium Online Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: An institution for the mentally ill?
questions.explanation:
asylum.

	Or anthem, aluminum, atheism, athleticism, aquarium, or antidisestablishmententarianism.

bantam.

	Or bum, bottom, bosom, balsam, Bolshevism, or Helena Bonham Carter.

column.

	Or catechism, colostrum, conundrum, condominium, or crumb.

delphinium.

	Or dumb, drum, denim, duodenum, or Dedham, Massachusetts.

questions.text: An offensive smell or waste product?
questions.explanation:
effluvium.

	Or envenom or encomium (a eulogy).

forum.

	Or fathom, factotum, fascism, fatalism, fanaticism, or Fauvism (the painting school to which Matisse belonged).

graham.

	Or gum, gingham, gallium (a metallic element), gigantism, gymnasium, or Gollum, my precioussss.

harmonium.

	Or hum or hafnium (a metallic element) or hahnium (a radioactive element).

questions.text: An expression that is peculiar to a language?
questions.explanation:
idiom.

	Or idealism, ileum (part of the small intestine), iridium (a metallic element), or ad infinitum.

jetsam & jetsom.

	Or jingoism or jugulum (a part of a bird's neck).

questions.text: An area ruled by a king?
questions.explanation:
kingdom.

	Or Kirkham, a town in Lancashire, England.

laudanum.

	Or lyricism, lyceum, lithium, linoleum, or laburnum (a kind of tree).

minimum.

	Or mum, madam, magnum, magnesium, meconium (a newborn baby's first poop), millenium, modicum, or momentum.

numb.

	Or neoplasm, nepotism, narcissism, nativism, nihilism, or a noisome insect.

optimism.

	Or odeum (a concert hall) or opprobrium, organism, or opossum.

plumb.

	Or plum, pabulum, phantom, pacifism, paganism, populism, priggism, pugilism, pygmyism, possum, palladium, paroxysm, podium, pendulum, plectrum, or pomatum.

questions.text: In a body of lawmakers, an adequate number of members present?
questions.explanation:
quorum.

	Or quantum physics or queendom.

racism.

	Or rum, radium, realism, rowdyish, royalism, ruralism, rebeldom, rectum, rhythm, or rosarium (a rose garden).

sanctum.

	Or sum, some, scrum, sacrum (a pelvic bone), sadism, satanism, solecism, sarcasm, sexism, snobbism, sophism, stoicism, schism, spasm, spectrum, speculum, sternum, stickum, saintdom, selfdom, serfdom, sheikdom, serum, solarium, scrotum, skookum (excellent), synonym, sorghum, or strum.

Thumb.

	Or totem, teetotum (a spinning toy), terrarium, thraldom, tsardom, tedium, toadyism, tokenism, or tympanum (the middle ear).

uranium.

	Or ultimatum, unbosom, unionism, urbanism, or um.

questions.text: A place for raising and keeping live animals?
questions.explanation:
vivarium.

	Or veganism, vitalism, vocalism, or velum.

witticism.

	Or wampum or whilom (formerly).

questions.text: I'm skipping X. Short for YUMMY?
questions.explanation:
yum.

	Or yahooism.

questions.text: Attribution of animal characteristics to a god? (Think of ANTHROPOMORPHISM.)
questions.explanation:
zoomorphism.

	Or zirconium.
